page.title: 14Heslington Tilmire
page.content: {Line A:}The southern edge of the golf course:- This line revealed a rich variety of grasses, plants, shrubs and insects. We discovered later that this was a dumping ground for the soil, weeds and rough grasses from the golf course. Nearby was a natural pond drying out in the summer heat. Here are our findings:{Grasses:-}sheeps fescue, purple moor, rough meadow, marsh club rush, white beak sedge, tufted hair, common cotton, blue moor. {Plants, shrubs, trees:-}dock, wild rhubarb, buttercup clover,daisy, dandelion, white clover,silver birch, bramble.{Insects:-}blood red ant,4 and 7 spotted red ladybirds, greenfly, garden spider, bluebottle, wood louse, red admiral butterfly, earthworm, harvestman spider,bark beetle,house fly,common frog,cranefly, lace border moth,14 spotted yellow ladybird.
